article: nifty50 index failed to hold above 11550 and corrected sharply towards 11393 level it remained under pressure for most part of day but a strong rebound was seen from lower levels in the last hour of the session the index formed a hammer kind of candle on the daily scale which suggests supports at lower levels while the immediate trend is of a lower top and lower bottom which is dragging nifty to lower levels now it needs to cross and hold above 11500 to witness an upward move towards 11550 and then 11620 levels while on the downside support is seen at 11420 and 11400 levels on the options front maximum put open interest was at 11400 followed by 11500 while maximum call oi was at 11800 11600 and 12000 meaningful call writing was seen at 11600 followed by 11500 level whereas put writing was seen at strike price 11400 india vix fell 102 per cent to 1364 a pause in the vix after a sharp spurt of 10 per cent indicated that some consolidation could be seen near support levels bank nifty fell sharply towards 27136 level but managed to recover from the lows and formed a longlegged doji candle which indicated a tug of war after the recent decline of 1250 points from its top of 28338 mark now it has to hold above 27250 to witness a bounce towards 27440 and then 27750 levels while on the downside support is seen at 27165 and then 27000 levels nifty futures closed in the negative at 11512 with a loss of 053 per cent there was long buildup in   granules  kscl and hindalco whereas shorts were seen in bel balkrishna industries chola finance dcb igl  and oriental bank of commerce
title: F&O: Pause in VIX after a sharp spurt signals more consolidation

article: depreciating rupee along with weak global cues took a toll on equity benchmarks on wednesday the nse opened modestly positive but slipped soon later the weakness intensified as the index losing nearly 1 per cent with broader market witnessing even wider cracks however in the last hour and half the nifty recovered nearly 85 points and ended 4335 points or 038 lower two technically important developments occurred in wednesdays trade first with the way the market rebounded from the lows nifty marked the level of 11393 as important support in the immediate near term the index established the range for the current consolidation with the level of 11760 acting as the upper end second wednesdays decline showed significant addition of shorts in the system which may lend support to the markets at lower levels thursday is likely to see the levels of 11530 and 11585 acting as immediate resistance area supports may come in at 11430 and 11375 zones the relative strength index rsi on the daily chart is 516429 it is bearish as it has marked a fresh 14period low and it also showed a bearish divergence against the price the daily macd is bearish as it trades below its signal line on the candles a long lower shadow which resembled a hammer occurred since this has occurred after a sharp decline we expect a temporary respite from the current decline as the market can find bottom near the bars lower price level however this needs confirmation on the next trading bar the pattern analysis showed that after the breakout that the market had from the 11000mark the nifty had run up much ahead of its usual band what the index is witnessing is a classical mean reversion and few healthy corrective moves overall unless we have any new negative news flows to deal with we may expect a stable start to the day we can also expect some mild upmoves and the nifty attempting to arrest its downsides and showing some technical pullback in all likelihood the level of 1139011400 is likely to provide support and the nifty is likely to continue in the broad trading range with limited downsides given the number of shorts that exists in the system we recommend using downsides if any to make select purchase while creating shorts may be avoided while conserving cash to protect positions positively cautious approach is advised for the day stocks to watch shorts positions are seen being added in stocks like  ncc infy  reliance bank of baroda hdfc itc orient bank ltfh ongc and
title: Trade setup: Nifty50 to stabilise; expect some technical pullback

article: the nifty50 index witnessed supportbased buying after the decline of last three sessions as it managed to hold above 11500 and headed towards 11562 level the index formed a hammer candle on the daily scale for the second consecutive session which indicated supportbase buying at lower levels it managed to take a pause from its immediate selling pressure but requires followup buying interest above 11550 to witness an upward move towards 11620 and then 11666 level while on the downside supports are seen at 11450 and then 11420 levels on the options front maximum put open interest was at 11400 followed by 11500 while maximum call oi was at 11800 and then 11600 and 12000 there was marginal call writing at 11700 followed by 11650 levels whereas put writing was seen at 11500 followed by 11400 india vix moved up 051 per cent to 1372 a pause in vix after a sharp rise of 10 per cent indicated some consolidation at support zones bank remained highly volatile throughout the session but finally negated the formation of lower highs and lower lows on the daily scale it formed a high wave doji candle which indicated a tug of war after the recent decline of 1250 points from its top of 28388 now it has to hold above 27440 to witness a bounce towards 2770027750 zone while on the downside support was seen at 27250 and then 27165 levels nifty futures closed in the positive at 11546 with a gain of 025 per cent long buildup was seen in  torrent power torrent pharma granules  balrampur chini and biocon while shorts were seen in chola finance  godrej consumer zeel  shriram transport finance and amara raja
title: F&O: Nifty shows strength but needs follow-up buying

article: the market opened on a subdued note on tuesday and remained rangebound for the first half of the session however the last two hours of the trade were very disappointing as the rupee fell to its fresh lifetime low and it affected the domestic market which were grappling with negative global cues the nse benchmark saw a sharp decline and went on to test its 50dma before ending the day with a deep cut of 15060 points or 132 per cent the damage was secular and all the sectoral indices ended in the red the nifty has ended a notch above its 50dma and we can expect this level to act as support on a closing basis the index has lost over 300 points in the last two sessions we can expect some support to come in at the c urrent levels a muted start to the trade cannot be ruled out on wednesday even if there are minor downsides the 50dma level which stand at 11274 level should act as an interim support the levels of 11325 and 11390 are expected to act as technical resistance to nifty whereas 11250 mark followed by 11210 is expected to lend support the relative strength index rsi on the weekly chart is 402086 it is bearish as it has marked its fresh 14period low but it shows no divergence against its price the daily macd stays bearish trading below its signal line the pattern analysis shows that the market is classically reverting to its mean after it ran away too ahead of its curve however tuesdays decline was slightly overextended in nature overall as we approach the market on wednesday ahead of the holiday on thursday we recommend staying away from taking any directional call in the market shorts should be avoided as there is little tradable gap on the downsides and also because there are still significant number of shorts that exists in the system on the long side there are chances of participants turning cautious at higher levels in event of a pullback given a trading holiday in between we recommend avoiding any kind of directional bets in the market until it is seen getting little stabilised while preserving liquidity to protect existing trading positions very cautious view is advised for the day stable technical conditions are observed in stocks of    asian paints alankit century plyboards citi   nitin fire products ccl products and motilal oswal finance
title: Trade setup: Nifty50 has support at 50-DMA; avoid shorts for now

article: overseas portfolio investors started the current round of major selloff on dalal street towards the later part of the september quarter which turned the market highly volatile while foreign portfolio investors   have been withdrawing from most emerging markets ever since the us economy started firing and bond yields there turned more attractive soaring crude oil prices and a falling rupee only hastened this selloff fpis offloaded stocks worth rs 6000 crore in the domestic market in q2 and at least double that amount in september and october curiously at the same time they were busy picking stocks from sectors like chemicals abrasives auto ancillary select private and public banks pharma and information technology within the bse500 basket fpis raised stakes in almost half or over 200 stocks during the quarter among notable names aarti industries saw fpi holding go up to 420 per cent at the end of september quarter from 380 per cent at the end of june quarter among others fpi holding went up from 402 per cent to 411 per cent in gujarat fluorochemicals from 547 per cent to 559 per cent in atul 236 per cent to 245 per cent in himadri speciality chemicals 2395 per cent to 2441 per cent in jubilant life sciences and 1183 per cent to 1187 per cent in pidilite industries shares of aarti industries and atul have rallied 10 per cent and 1778 per cent respectively so far in 2018 whereas those of himadri speciality chemical and jubilant life sciences are down 19 per cent and 1351 per cent respectively as many as 489 companies from the bse500 index reported their shareholding patterns for the september quarter till october 21 according to corporate database ace equity foreign portfolio flows into equities turned positive in july and august after an outflow of more than rs 20000 crore during the first quarter of 201819 however fpi outflow of rs 10824 crore in september against net investment of around rs 4040 crore in july and august set the clock back resulting in net outflow for second quarter several banks also saw fpi holding go up during the quarter au small finance bank dcb bank the jammu  kashmir bank the  allahabad bank  central bank of india idbi bank and union bank of india all recorded increase in fpi holding during the quarter select beatendown construction and real estate players also managed to attract overseas investors money during the quarter among them were included dilip buildcon dlf indiabulls real estate and sunteck realty these shares incidentally were down up to 53 per cent on yeartodate basis till october 19 fpis also did a fair bit of shopping in the nbfc space raising their holdings in bajaj finance to 2008 per cent from 2005 per cent the stock is up 24 per cent so far in 2018 fpis also bought additional shares of capital first ifdc manappuram finance reliance capital shriram city union finance of india and tata investment corporation shares of these companies are down up to 60 per cent this calendar fpi holding went up from 5434 per cent to 5552 per cent in indiabulls housing finance 5242 per cent to 5447 per cent in  4741 per cent to 4870 per cent in shriram transport finance 4290 to 4537 per cent in care ratings 4308 to 4317 per cent in cyient 4069 to 4237 per cent in upl 4220 to 4229 per cent in bharti infratel 4030 to 4217 per cent in team lease services 4073 to 4217 per cent in niit technologies and 4077 to 4081 per cent in zee entertainment however bharat financial inclusion indusind bank axis bank icici bank apollo hospital enterprise yes bank pvr sobha mahindra  mahindra financial services tata power piramal enterprises delta corp and radico khaitan were among 268 stocks where fpis offloaded significant amount of shares during q2 they reduced holdings in hdfc from 7289 per cent to 7219 per cent and in hdfc bank from 4086 per cent to 3918 per cent on the other hand these overseas portfolio investors kept their holdings intact in bank of maharashtra corporation bank forbes  company greenply industries indian overseas bank ratnamani metals  tubes solar industries and the new india assurance
title: FPIs sold Rs 6,000 crore shares in Q2, but lapped up these 208 stocks

article: new delhi a wave of selling pressure triggered by depressed global cues amid worries over earnings and economic growth hit local stocks real hard today geopolitical uncertainty around the us and saudi arabia a falling rupee the fo rollover and sustained fii outflow all ganged up to pin the market down a day after it scored healthy gains the sensex plunged 344 points or 101 per cent to 33690 while the nifty went down 100 points or 098 per cent to 1012490 today midcaps and smallcaps too buckled under pressure falling up to 098 per cent lets get todays market ground report as many as 23 stocks fell in the sensex kitty of stocks among the losers bharti airtel was in the lead with a loss of 660 per cent it was followed by vedanta  adani ports yes bank and hdfc wipro on the other hand jumped 330 per cent leading the pack of sensex gainers other than that only coal india kotak mahindra bank asian paints powergrid mahindra  mahindra and tata consultancy services could manage to settle in the green the domestic unit settled 12 paise lower at 7327 against the dollar today traders said increased demand for the us currency from importers and a lower opening of the domestic equity market weighed on the local unit despite steps taken by the government and the rbi the rupees slide remains unabated posing a threat to indias macroeconomic mathematics a selloff in the us stocks sparked panic in asian markets and most of them suffered heavy losses however they managed to limited their losses as investors looked forward to corporate earnings the shanghai composite closed the day flat european stocks turned green ahead of a rate decision by the european central bank indias biggest carmaker maruti suzuki india on thursday reported a 98 per cent fall in net profit for the quarter to september operating profit stood at rs 27101 crore down 95 per cent over the same period last year on account of increase in commodity prices adverse foreign exchange movement and higher sales promotion expenses partially offset by cost reduction efforts shares of the company closed at rs 672470 down 065 per cent on the bse today infibeam avenues down 1801 per cent dish tv india down 1717 per cent mcx down 1417 per cent linde india down 972 per cent and jubilant foodworks down 971 per cent stood as the top five bse losers today but sjvn up 1375 per cent intellect design arena up 839 per cent kajaria ceramics up 759 per cent interglobe aviation up 748 per cent and oriental bank of commerce up 650 per cent surged defying negative market mood over 117 lakh crore investor wealth was eroded on thursday as the cumulative market capitalisation of bselisted companies fell to rs 1340710228 crore from rs 1352462912 a day earlier as many as 284 stocks including  bajaj auto bank of india beml bharat forge ceat dhfl grasim maruti and tata motors hit 52week lows on the bse only 26 stocks including coastal corporation jet infraventure prakash steelage rotographics india and shukra bullions could touch their 52week highs
title: After Market: Rs 1 lakh crore gone; 300 stocks at 52-week lows

article: new delhi as many as 106 stocks including aegis logistics ashoka buildcon dilip buildcon and emami infrastructure hit fresh 52week highs on nse on thursday shares of future retail  jindal steel  power jmc projects india man industries india mastek  parsvnath developers   thermax tv18 broadcast and zandu realty also joined the club of stocks that hit fresh 52week highs today on the other hand 22 stocks including 5paisa capital   shyam telecom supreme tex mart tv vision and videocon industries hit fresh 52week lows on nse the nifty50 index closed 6 points up at 10349 while the bse settled 27 points up at 33588 extending the gains for the sixth session infosys reliance industries  yes bank eicher motors and tech mahindra settled as the top gainers in the nifty50 index on the contrary dr reddys adani ports indiabulls housing finance  asian paints and stood as the top losers of the day among the 50 stocks in the nifty50 index 21 ended the day in the green while 29 in the red
title: Over 100 stocks hit fresh 52-week highs on NSE on Thursday

article: new delhi the domestic equity market ended on a negative note last week thus posting its first weekly loss in six weeks subdued global cues and heavy selling in it and pharma stocks weighed on investor sentiment the sp bse ended 015 per cent lower for the week at 34915 while the nifty settled at 10618 down 069 per cent heres a list of seven developments that may move the market in the coming week among notable names  tata chemicals and tata coffee are slated to announce januarymarch results on monday while abb india and will unveil their score cards on tuesday eicher motors and jspl are scheduled to announce results on wednesday adani enterprises asian paints nestle india tata communications titan company union bank of india and zee entertainment enterprises will release their quarterly numbers on thursday and tata global beverages will announce januarymarch numbers on friday the karnataka legislative assembly elections 2018 is scheduled to be held across the state on may 12 results of the poll will be out on may 15 leading parties the ruling congress and the bjp have been campaigning aggressively in the state for the last few months to woo voters chief minister siddaramaiah will be fighting against bjps bs for the cms post in the upcoming polls market will keenly follow the developments from the state us job growth increased lessthanexpected in april and the unemployment rate dropped to near a 175year low of 39 per cent as some outofwork americans left the labour force reuters reported the report also showed wages barely rose last month which may ease concerns that inflation pressures are rapidly building up likely keeping the federal reserve on a gradual path of monetary policy tightening financial markets across the globe including india may react to it when trading resumes on monday oil prices rose about 2 per cent on friday with us crude hitting its highest in more than three years as global supplies remained tight and the market awaited news from washington on possible new sanctions against iran reuters reported on may 12 the us president will decide whether to extend waivers on economic sanctions against iran if it doesnt the global market could lose about one million barrels of oil a day says a market watch report the sanctions on iran were lifted under a 2015 agreement among a group of world powers including the us and iran aimed at curbing tehrans nuclear activities the nifty50 index on friday formed a dark cloud cover pattern on daily chart suggesting possible downside ahead the pattern may have negative repercussions which will be confirmed if the nifty50 closes below the 10600 level said mazhar mohammad of chartviewindiain however gaurav ratnaparkhi senior technical analyst sharekhan has a bullish outlook on the index for the short term with a target 10910 and reversal placed at 10500 the short term trend will remain bullish as long as it does not close below 10500 on the way up 10708  10785 will be crucial resistance in the near term the rise in the benchmark index can stretch towards 10910 if it breaks the crucial resistance level of 10785 ratnaparkhi said the government will release industrial production data for march on friday indias industrial output grew 71 per cent in february from a year earlier this apart the government will also unveil inflation data based on consumer price index cpi for april retail inflation stood at 428 per cent in march slowing for the third straight month from a 17month high according to data released by the central statistics office the big central banking event of next week is the bank of englands may 10 meeting with market expectations overwhelmingly in favour of interest rates being held at the current 05 per cent interest rate bets have swung around sharply from early april when investors priced a 90 per cent chance of the boe raising rates by 25 basis points reuters reported in addition the bank of japan boj monetary policy meeting minutes will be unveiled on monday 7 may 2018
title: Karnataka polls, Q4 earnings among 7 key factors that will guide market next week

article: new delhi domestic shares are likely to see a flat opening on monday tracking nifty on singapore stock exchange sgx and mixed global cues at 0750 am the nifty futures on sgx were trading 750 points or 007 per cent lower at 1081550 here is a list of top stocks that are likely to be in focus in todays trading session hindustan unilever hul  godrej agro blue star kec international south indian bank and polaris would be among the companies scheduled to report their quarterly numbers during the day in view of mounting nonperforming assets npas the rbi directed dena bank not to issue any fresh loans and hire new personnel after dena bank  the reserve bank now is likely to impose certain restrictions on couple of more public sector lenders under the prompt corrective action pca mechanism due to worsening asset quality a source said public sector lender oriental bank of commerce obc net loss widened to rs 165022 crore for the quarter ended march of 201718 the bank had made a net loss of rs 121801 crore during the corresponding quarter of the preceding fiscal ended march 2017 net loss of reported to rs 485977 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against net profit of rs 21418 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 total operating income declined 257 per cent to rs 1022341 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 1049292 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 monnet ispat jsw steel on saturday said the competition commission of india has approved bid by a consortium led by it to acquire bankrupt monnet ispat and energy ltd miel in an insolvency auction realestate firm godrej properties has cut its net debt by around rs 650 crore during last fiscal on the back of strong sales bookings and also brought down average borrowing cost by one percentage point auromedics pharma a us subsidiary of aurobindo pharma has initiated voluntary recall of two lots each of two injections from the us market following customer complaints about presence of particles in the vial the fresh recall follows a recent withdrawal of over 15 million injections by the firm due to lack of assurance of sterility jk cements standalone net profit more than doubled to rs 9645 crore for the fourth quarter ended march 2018 helped by lower tax expenses the company had posted a net profit of rs 4257 crore in the same quarter of the previous fiscal the firm reported 11835 per cent increase in net profit during the financial year ended march 31 2018 on account of lower claims and reduction in expenses during the year the company reported net profit of rs 2201 crore as against rs 1008 crore a year ago the board recommended a one for one bonus the bank reported a net loss of rs 3510 crore in the fourth quarter owing to higher loan risk coverage as well as taking cover against frauds involving punjab national bank and diamond trader nirav modi the bank posted net profit of rs 111 crore in the yearago period clsa has raised target price on asian paints to rs 1460 from rs 1365 the companys volume growth accelerated to double digits in the fourth quarter which was a positive after singledigit volume growth recently said the brokerage the brokerage said while the continued rise in input prices and rupee depreciation are worries and management expects further firmup in input basket the recent price hike of 34 per cent since march 2018 should help somewhat it added the foreign brokerage hsbc has maintained a buy rating on nestle india and raised target price to rs 11000 from rs 8950 the firm views the company as a play on the growth in indian consumption as percapita income increases asias oldest bourse bse is planning to seek us regulators nod for holding the status of foreign board of trade fbt for its india international exchange in gift city a top bse official has said the company has filed a legal suit against haier appliances india accusing chinas largest appliance maker of ambush marketing by running an advertisement campaign that allegedly spoofs a campaign of the tata group company two senior industry executives said metals magnate anil agarwal wants the dedicated bankruptcy court to consider the vedanta resources bid for essar steel arguing that bankers to the stressed alloymaker themselves had urged him to join the auction to increase competitive intensity and fetch creditors a better price for the troubled mill net profit of rose 3998 per cent to rs 7156 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 5112 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 sales rose 038 per cent to rs 168840 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 168197 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017  net profit of rose 2043 per cent to rs 21181 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 17588 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 sales rose 696 per cent to rs 117958 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 110281 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 net profit of declined 3260 per cent to rs 7132 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 10582 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 sales declined 1397 per cent to rs 45154 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 52489 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 net profit of rose 9900 per cent to rs 6595 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 3314 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 sales rose 2381 per cent to rs 173361 crore in the quarter ended march 2018 as against rs 140022 crore during the previous quarter ended march 2017 future groups value fashion format fbb plans to invest rs 350 crore to open about 140 exclusive outlets as it aims to double turnover in the next two years at present fbb retails its products through 385 points of sales in big bazaar stores including 62 exclusive outlets
title: Stocks in focus on May 14, 2018

article: new delhi around 18 stocks rose to touch their 52week highs on nse in mondays session among the stocks that touched their 52week highs were  balaxi ventures gillette india honeywell automation and kajaria ceramics maheshwari logistics metropolis healthcare pidilite industries rail vikas nigam sakar healthcare seamec zodiac clothing company also featured among the stocks that touched their 52week highs on nse benchmark nse nifty index was trading 2710 points up at 1167055 while the bse sensex was trading 9377 points up at 3886088 overall 30 shares were trading in the green in nifty50 index while 20 were trading in the red in the afternoon trade in the nifty 50 index tata motors tcs coal india ltd tata steel and hero motocorp were among the top gainers while infosys sun pharma bharti infratel indian oil corp and bpcl were trading in the red
title: Share market update: 18 stocks hit 52-week highs on NSE

article: new delhi around 22 stocks rose to touch their 52week highs on nse in tuesdays session among the stocks that touched their 52week highs were 63 moons technologies arss infrastructure projects astrazeneca pharma and  indraprastha gas jsw holdings kajaria ceramics bank of maharashtra info edge india metropolis healthcare polycab india relaxo footwears and rail vikas nigam also featured among the stocks that touched their 52week highs on nse benchmark nse nifty index was trading 9170 points up at 1178205 while the bse sensex was trading 35233 points up at 3925817 overall 41 shares were trading in the green in the nifty50 index while 9 were trading in the red in the nifty 50 index icici bank larsen  toubro asian paints indusind bank and bharti infratel were among the top gainers while tata motors cipla bharti airtel infosys and coal india were trading in the red
title: Share market update: 22 stocks hit 52-week highs on NSE

article: new delhi firm gillette india has reported 23 per cent rise in for the march quarter at rs 8776 crore helped by increased productivity and cost efficiency the company which follows julyjune financial year reported profit after tax pat of rs 7132 crore for januarymarch 2018 gillette india said total income during the latest quarter was up 358 per cent to rs 46884 crore as against rs 45260 crore in the yearago period total expenses declined 378 per cent to rs 33268 crore in the latest march quarter as against rs 34576 crore earlier the increase in pat was due to continued focus on productivity cost efficiency and reduced advertising spend during the quarter the company said we have delivered growth for the third consecutive quarter this year driven by category development and execution excellence gillette india md said revenue from grooming segment stood at rs 38054 crore and oral care contributed rs 8497 crore shares of gillette india were trading at rs 688120 apiece down 181 per cent on the bse
title: Gillette India March quarter PAT up 23% to Rs 88 crore

article: nifty futures on the singapore exchange were trading 37 points or 035 per cent higher at 10579 indicating a positive start for the nifty50 heres a list of stocks which may hog limelight in todays session net income attributable to taro stood at 626 million in september quarter compared with 524 million in the yearago quarter a 102 million increase resulting in diluted earnings per share of 160 compared to 130 voltas manappuram finance aditya birla capital graphite india dr lal pathlabs balmer lawrie investments and noida toll bridge company which will announce their quarterly results later in the day the company said said it has repaid commercial paper cp worth rs 1775 crore since september 21 2018 has repaid commercial paper holders rs 9465 crore including buyback worth rs 3240 crore the company said in a statement stateowned said it will divest its stake either fully or partially in various joint venture firms the board of directors of the bank accorded its approval for divestment of banks stake in full or in part in joint venture investments of the bank  asrec india india international bank malaysia bhd and indiafirst life insurance co the companys said it has issued commercial papers of rs 100 crore with a maturity date of february 4 2019 the power utility firm reported a 786 per cent yearonyear rise in profit at rs 230949 crore for the quarter ended september 30 the firm had posted a profit of rs 214104 crore in the corresponding quarter last year the pharma firm has entered into an agreement to acquire 20 per cent equity stake in the api and intermediate business of hyderabad based optimus group the acquisition value is rs 120 crore a company statement said hindustan construction company hcc announced that rights issue committee will this month discuss various matters including determination of the issue price hcc had earlier announced that it will raise up to rs 500 crore through rights issues the companyhas reported widening of its consolidated net loss to rs 142 crore for the quarter ended september 2018 mainly impacted by impairment of goodwill and investments the company also said all approvals are in place for fund infusion of rs 4000 crore from ihh healthcare berhad and the transaction will be completed shortly pnb india insurance company has received market regulator sebis goahead to float an initial public offer ipo according to the draft papers the companys public issue will put up 495898076 shares for sale which equals 2464 stake dilution indias housing finance companies are facing a liquidity stress a situation that will put more pressure on the reserve bank of india to provide a special window to the sector as sought by the government corporate affairs secretary injeti srinivas said the company will adopt a unified branding strategy for all newlyacquired companies a top official of the steel major said on monday the company has recently taken over stressed steel plants of bhushan steel and the steel business of usha martin it is also vying for more assets referred to the nclt the company reported a 32per cent onyear decline in net profit to rs 2466 crore in the quarter ended september owing to lower sales and a weak rupee the godrej industries arm posted 1658 per cent jump in consolidated net profit at rs 9912 crore in the second quarter of the 201819 fiscal on strong incomethe companys net profit stood at rs 8502 crore in the same quarter previous fiscal as per regulatory filing hals new chief r madhavan has asked that the staterun aircraft maker be kept out of the political row over the rafale deal the opposition has accused the government of ignoring hal while awarding offsets contracts the contract to build the strategically important rs 6800crore zojila tunnel in jammu and kashmir which was awarded to infrastructure leasing  financial services may be put up for bidding again announced a new partnership with check point software technologies a leading provider of cyber security solutions globally to deliver check points advanced and dynamic cloud security solution cloudguard iaas new delhi television ltd ndtv posted a consolidated net profit after tax of rs 59 lakh for the second quarter ended september 30 the company had reported a net loss of rs 2314 crore during the julyseptember last fiscal the lender swung into profit in the julyseptember period after three consecutive quarters of losses as provisions slowed and retail and corporate loans grew net profit in q2 stood at rs 945 crore after a rs 4876crore loss in apriljune 2018the government has asked the new board of debtridden ilfs to inform it at the earliest whether the company can undertake the construction of the major infrastructure project the upside for indias largest forging company bharat forge is likely to remain capped in the medium term despite its september quarter results beating street estimates revenue growth is expected to moderate from commercial vehicle makers for domestic and overseas customers as the current year is likely to be a peak year for revenue growth in the current cycle broking firms have maintained their bullish view on axis bank after indias thirdlargest private lender on friday reported betterthanexpected financial results for the quarter through september
title: Stocks in the news: DHFL, Fortis Healthcare, HCC, Andhra Bank and Power Grid

article: shares of jumped over 5 per cent early on tuesday after the stateowned lender said it will divest its stake either fully or partially in various joint venture firms the scrip was trading 574 per cent up at rs 3040 at around 932 am the sensex was up 061 per cent at 35164 the board of the bank at its meeting on november 3 accorded its approval for divestment of banks stake in full or in part in joint venture investments  asrec india ltd india international bank malaysia bhd and indiafirst life insurance co ltd  andhra bank said in a regulatory filing indiafirst is a joint venture between bank of baroda 44 per cent andhra bank 30 per cent and uks wealth and investment management firm legal  general 26 per cent india international bank malaysia berhad iibm is a jv of stateowned bank of baroda 40 per cent 35 per cent and andhra bank 25 per cent that began its operations in july 2012 asrec owned by 2704 per cent bank of india 2602 per cent andhra bank 2602 per cent 1122 per cent lic 918 per cent 051 per cent is into securitisation and reconstruction of financial assets business andhra bank earlier last week posted a net loss of rs 434 crore for the second quarter to september as against a net loss of rs 38511 crore in the same period last year
title: Andhra Bank rallies over 5% on divestment plan

article: new delhi the indian market is expected to open flat on wednesday tracking mixed trend seen in other asian markets the market was able to find support at lower level and it looks like the buyers are using market correction to create long positions however the low at 8590 level is the key for the pattern rohit gadia founder  ceo capitalvia global research ltd told etmarketscom going forward a move below this level could trigger profit booking overall we expect a short term correction ifmarketmove below 8590 level he added drug firm reported a 2381 per cent rise in consolidated net profit to rs 58496 crore for the first quarter ended june 30 2016 mainly on account of robust sales setting an ambitious target of having five million customers by 2020 and to become the no 3 player in the extremely competitive industry midsized lender made a foray into the credit card market  rcom has launched content delivery network fast edge for faster delivery of web content to users indias no 3 mobile phone carrier  strongly denied a news report on tuesday that it was in exploratory talks about a merger with larger rival vodafone india qualys inc announced an expanded strategic partnership with limited wipro will leverage qualys vulnerability management policy compliance and web application security services in its managed enterprise security service offerings for its customers worldwide said a media report videsh ltd the overseas arm of corp ongc has received oneyear extension to explore a vietnamese oil block in the contested waters of the south china sea stateowned refiner corp ltd hpcl and gas utility will divest up to 50 per cent stake in the rs 30000 crore petrochemical plant which is being set up in andhra pradesh kolkatabased integrated infrastructure institution has filed the draft shelf prospectus with markets watchdog securities and exchange board of india sebi bse and nse for its proposed secured redeemable nonconvertible debentures ncds of face value rs 1000 each aggregating to rs 1000 crore reported 501 per cent yearonyear yoy growth in the net profit to rs 803 crore for the quarter ended june 30 compared with 5350 crore reported in the yearago period the infrastructure player plans to raise up to rs 2500 crore through issuance of equity shares equity linked instruments debentures or any other securities article: new delhi domestic equity indices are likely to open on a flat to positive note on thursday as investors react to data showing an yearonyear slowdown in second quarter gdp growth and a surge in prices after the organisation of the petroleum exporting countries opec reached a deal to slash production to boost crude prices brent crude futures for january delivery rose 882 per cent to 5047 a barrel while february futures rallied 89 per cent to 5151 after opec members agreed to cut production from january by around 12 million barrels per day bpd or over 3 per cent to 325 million bpd us wti crude futures for january delivery advanced 421 or 96 per cent to 4944 a barrel the expanded 73 per cent in the julyseptember quarter data released by the statistics office showed faster than the 71 per cent growth reported for the prior three months but below the 76 per cent increase recorded in the yearago period it also missed economists median estimate of 75 per cent going ahead activity is expected to slow down due to the cash crunch seen post demonetisation move but it is too early to assess the full impact there is hardly any high frequency indicator available post the move we will assess the situation as data becomes available and more clarity emerges on the governments policy response securities said in a note at 755 am futures on the singapore stock exchange were trading 1450 points higher at 825450 indicating a positive opening for the domestic  the riskreward for nifty50 is more balanced now versus being unattractively skewed prior to the recent correction the range of the skew is quite wide now suggesting heightened uncertainty around potential outcomes said ubs in a note the global brokerage expects the sensex to hit 30500 by end2017 lower than its previous target of 32400 our forecast is based on a target forward pe of 172 times one above the last fiveyear average due to the improving growth profile and lower cost of equity and eps growth estimates of 6 per cent for cy16e and 12 per cent for cy17e the brokerage said the initial public offering ipo of sheela foam the manufacturer of sleepwell mattresses was subscribed 589 per cent till the end of second day of the issue on wednesday the public offer received bids for 323440 shares as against 5250001 shares offered by the company according to the data available with stock exchanges till 0500 pm the list includes  dilip buildcon and a2z infra a total of 54 bselisted firms were due to announce their quarterly results during the ongoing trading week a long white day or strong bullish candle on the daily charts and crossing of the 200day sma are positive signs for the bulls the index is on track to hit its next crucial level of 8300 as long as it stays above its 200day sma placed around the 8150 level experts said chinas csi300 index rose 075 per cent to 3564 on thursday morning japans equity benchmark nikkei rose 219 per cent to 18708 other asian indices including hong kongs hang seng up 079 per cent south koreas kospi up 008 per cent and taiwans twse up 027 per cent were trading higher the dow jones industrial average added 3322 points or 017 per cent to 19154 the sp500 index fell 262 points or 012 per cent to 2202 the nasdaq composite lost 5093 points or 095 per cent to 5328 the recent strong gdp numbers and figures on consumer spending data and us private are hinting at a rate hike by the us fed in its december 1314 policy review
title: Key market triggers to watch out before Opening Bell

article: et intelligence group procter  gamble pg hygiene health care and are three multinational blue chip companies trading at close to their threeyear low valuations their scalable businesses high earnings visibility and deep pockets that help them through uncertain times make them safe investments at a time when the governments drive has made future growth projections hazier the listed company of the global fmcg giant sells two major products feminine hygiene under the whisper brand and cold and coughrelief products under vicks brand demonetisation is not likely to have major impact on the sales of these products the feminine hygiene business has been growing in double digits for 13 years while vicks has been consistently increasing its market share currently 3839 in the september quarter it reported 12 yearonyear sales growth and 55 jump in operating profit ebit albeit on a lower base its ad spends to sales ratio was higher in the quarter which should help improve sales in the coming quarters the company sells mens grooming products under the brand gillette oral care products under oralb and portable power under the duracell brand mens grooming is the biggest contributor to sales with an annual growth of 16 in the last five and 10 years the oral care business turned around at the operating profit level in fy16 after the company stopped the loss making tooth paste business while the power business showed 50 growth in the september quarter sales grew by 8 and operating profit by 66 year on year ad spends to sales also increased marginally  the engine oil and lubricant companys stock has fallen almost 20 after it announced weak results for the september quarteraccording to analysts the strong monsoon limited the demand in the quarter resulting in a meagre 1 improvement in volume given the sharp decline the current stock price factors in most negatives including the demonetisation impact dividend yield at the current price is close to 3 which is attractive for a company with return on capital employed in triple digits
title: These three MNC blue chips are cheap now

article: good morning dear etmarkets readers with the domestic equity market recording four days of successive gains all eyes would be on the reserve bank of indias policy review beginning on tuesday where the central bank is widely expected to cut policy rate by 25 basis points over 130 companies are set to report quarterly during the day which could generate stockspecific actions lets check out what else might matter to dalal street on tuesday at 615 am nifty50 futures on the singapore stock exchange were trading 11 points higher at 8805 indicating a flat to negative opening for the domestic market the market is keenly awaiting the outcome of rbi policy meet and what happens in terms of a conclusive decision on the interest rate front shall be evident on wednesday a lot of big earnings numbers across sectors are awaited during the day including those of  and and the reactions to them shall be watched out for said mayuresh joshi fund manager angel broking many experts on dalal street are expecting rbi to slash policy rate by 25 basis points in the policy review starting on tuesday we foresee a 25bps cut in  the domestic macroeconomic backdrop remains one of benign with cpi likely to undershoot rbis indicative trajectory continued fiscal consolidation fiscal impulse is modestly negative and sustained weakness in private capex securities said in a note at the global level though uncertainty persists the situation still offers space as fed is not in a hurry to raise rates immediately and the dollar is showing a weakening bias moreover the rupee is also overvalued in our view this backdrop warrants a 25 bps rate cut the brokerage said the philadelphia federal reserve bank president on monday said he supports a march interest rate hike if growth in and wages remain steady i still am supportive of three rate hikes this year of course with a major caveat depending on how the economy evolves and policy fiscal policy evolves harker told reporters after a speech on the of fintech firms i think march should be considered as a potential for another 25basis point increase bhel  tata steel the ramco cements and would be some companies due to announce their quarterly results during the day among others ceat gammon infra    gmdc are also scheduled to report quarterly earnings during the day brokerage securities said the earnings results season has so far been in line with expectations in terms of headline numbers of the 26 nifty50 companies that have declared their results so far twothirds have reported earnings ahead ofin line with our estimates the earnings upgradedowngrade ratio is skewed in favour of downgrades with four companies seeing upgrades of 2 per cent or more and eight companies seeing downgrades of 2 per cent or more the brokerage said in a note the nifty50 on monday took out the 8800 level after five months of wait and in the process broke its rangebound movement to form short bull candle pattern on daily chart suggesting the index could add more weight in the coming sessions a short bull candle is a single candlestick pattern if the candles are short the trading action could be muted but the trend continues to be on the upside if the technical charts are to go by the index should see next resistance at around 8860 level brent futures dropped 109 or 19 per cent to settle at 5572 a barrel on monday us west texas intermediate wti crude shed 82 cents or 15 per cent to close at 5301 that was the lowest close for both contracts since january 31 reuters reported the drop was seen despite concerns over rising tensions between us and iran the domestic currency continued ended at a nearly threemonth high of 6722 against the us dollar on monday this was a 9 paise appreciation over fridays closing thanks to on sustained unwinding of dollars by exporters and corporates ahead of rbi policy asian markets across japan korea and australia were trading with a negative bias following a muted closing to us in overnight trade in the us the sp500 index edged 486 points or 021 per cent lower to 2292 the dow jones industrial average index declined 1904 points or 009 per cent to 20052 the nasdaq composite fell 321 points or 006 per cent to 5663
title: Pre-market: What changed overnight & top cues you need to know before Opening Bell

article: marcus wallenberg exchairman seb north european financial group wallenbergs statement underlines one key thing companies with enduring products can better cope with the ups and down of the than those without them companies with enduring generally have a diversified  sell their products worldwide and generate consistent revenue and operating profit margins market experts often term such as defensive and say one can consider them to protect their portfolios to ride occasional headwinds when you think of  the first thing that comes to mind are noodles a certain name like makes you think of a toothpaste they are the ones called enduring brands nestle indias brands such as maggi noodles and nescafe coffee are consumed across the  even after the fiasco over lead content in maggi the product saw robust response from consumers when it returned to stores in fact some websites sold their stock of maggi noodles within minutes of the relaunch when the dispute ended a consumer does not think twice while purchasing such products despite the trouble shares of the company managed to beat market return and advanced nearly 250 per cent since the beginning of 2016 till date for the quarter ended september 30 2016 nestle reported over twofold growth in net profit at rs 26939 crore compared with rs 12420 crore reported for the corresponding quarter last year jay prakash gupta director and ceo mdirect said companies with enduring brands or products are generally defensive in nature and are consistent performers in terms of stock returns these companies generally report healthy operating profit growth on a yearonyear basis gupta said these stocks are good options to think of in difficult times i believe companies like and procter  gamble hygiene  healthcare pg are among the safest bets that one consider for protecting a portfolio from contingencies he said the share price of gillette india has declined 8 per cent this year till date while that of pg has surged over 20 per cent in the same period market experts said one should look at the companys past track record of management corporate governance and the number of countries it serves in the smallcap space lt foods daawat basmati rice has emerged as an enduring brand with bollywood superstar amitabh bachchan as its brand ambassador the product is available in over 50 countries shares of the company have outperformed the benchmark in 2016 the scrip has surged nearly 5 per cent to rs 279 as of december 20 from rs 267 on january 1 2016 ambareesh baliga independent market analyst said enduring brands mostly help companies to through difficult times like we saw in the case of  these companies are extremely safe from an investment point of view chances of a sharp bounceback in such stocks are strong in case of severe correction one should look at the global brand value of such companies before investing one can also consider    pg and as their products are available in markets for ages is a domesticallygrown multinational adhesives manufacturing company it also produces art material construction chemicals and other industrial chemicals the fevicol brand of adhesives is the most famous product of the company
title: Stick with stocks of enduring brands for handsome returns through thick & thin

article: at 7 am this morning nifty futures were quoting mildly higher on singapore stock exchange in indications that the market is likely to remain rangebound the 50pack index formed a bullish harami pattern on the daily chart in mondays trade which indicates indecisiveness and that the bears are not getting a grip on the market mondays session was more of a continuation of the consolidation pattern with a minor uptick an inside bar occurred as the nifty50 formed a lower high and higher low market experts see no major surge in the domestic equity indices in the coming sessions the rs 1224 crore initial public offering of staterun housing and urban development corporation hudco kicked off on monday with the issue getting bids for over 63 per cent of the issue size on the first day of the bidding process data available with nse showed that the issue had received bids for 129136800 shares compared with 204058747 shares on the block procter  gamble hygiene  healthcare and  the indian subsidiaries of nyselisted procter  gamble announced special dividends which some perceive as a precursor to the merger of the two companies globally all pg are under one company except for in india in a situation where declining and rangebound markets have made purchasing or selling plain vanilla options an unattractive proposition savvy traders are beating the odds by resorting to the gamma scalping strategy this is done by buying call or put options and selling buying underlying stock futures or through a combination of call or put options the international monetary fund said asias economic outlook faces significant uncertainty and downside growth risks from any sudden tightening in global financial conditions or rise in protectionist trade policies the imf which in april raised its 2017 asiapacific growth forecast to 55 percent from its previous october forecast of 54 percent said loose monetary and fiscal policies across most of the region would underpin domestic demand asian markets were trading mixed on tuesday morning chinese stocks looked weak but hang seng and kospi were ruling higher european markets turned a bit weak on monday whole us stocks finishes flattish in overnight trade the sp 500 index barely finished in the positive territory up less than a point but it was enough to represent a record for the broadmarket benchmark at 2399 after briefly hitting a new intraday record of 2401 in early trading the nasdaq also managed a record at 610266 but finished flat up 190 points the dow jones industrial average rose 534 points or less than 01 at 21012
title: Opening Bell: What changed your market while you were sleeping

article: et intelligence group procter  gamble hygiene  healthcare and  the indian subsidiaries of nyselisted procter  gamble announced special dividends which some perceive as a precursor to the merger of the two companies globally all pg are under one company  except for in india in 2015 al rajwani was appointed as ceo and md of both the companies in india in addition there are four common names in the top management of the two companies as mentioned in the companies annual reports also over the past few quarters pg hhs weak and gillette indias strong performance have helped converge the valuations of both the companies which were wide apart a year ago on monday  after results gillette indias traded at trailing ear nings multiple of 59 and pghhs shares traded at a multiple of 55 a year ago gillette and pg hh shares traded at 73 and 49 times their trailing  respectively  a similarity in valuations would allow a noncontroversial ratio say analysts if the companies are merged we do not comment on speculation said a spokesperson for pghh and gillette india giving out almost the entire cash on books as dividends would help make the merger process easier in terms of swap ratio believe experts dividends are announced in may before their financial year ends in june a merger would help the two companies trim costs of staff marketing and branding thereby improving profitability  also with a wider portfolio the merged entity would have a better negotiating power with retailers on monday  gillette shares traded at 4820 92 higher over the previous days close and pg hh shares traded 51 higher 7782 the parent group pg owns 7064 in gillette india and 75 in pghh
title: Special dividends hint at P&G-Gillette merger?

article: new delhi it was a week marked by over 1 per cent surge in the benchmark indices on the marketfriendly outcome from the french presidential elections and imds prediction of a normal rainfall back home while from a few heavyweights did not meet street expectations the momentum largely remained strong through the week on sustained foreign flows thanks to a stronger rupee which settled at 6431 to the dollar for the week the bse jumped 329 points or 110 per cent during the week to settle at 30188 on friday while the nifty50 rose 115 points or 124 per cent for the week to close at 9400 barring chinas shanghai composite down 063 per cent and us dow jones down 053 per cent major global equity indices rose up to 28 per cent with hong kongs hang seng 078 per cent and japanese nikkei up 225 per cent led the charge nymex crude prices rose 35 per cent for the week to 4784 a barrel prices rose 06 per cent while lost 211 per cent of value in the domestic  foreign inflows into equities stood at rs 1830 which outpaced the rs 99938 crore withdrawals by domestic institutional investors during the week heres a look at some of the that hogged limelight during the day the stock ended 1027 per cent lower for the week thanks to a sharp 1619 per cent plunge in its share price on friday alone which wiped out consecutive gains for the previous four days a nonshow by zetia generic which had received 180day exclusivity during the december quarter resulted in lessthanexpected fourth quarter numbers this stock crashed 78 per cent last week this includes four days of consecutive declines in its annual report the bank said its gross npas nonperforming assets after an rbi assessment for the fiscal year ended march 2016 stood at rs 4926 crore more than six times the rs 749 crore the bank had reported that year the rs 1200 crore initial public offering of hudco received bids worth rs 97000 crore this was the highest oversubscription in any psu disinvestment the issue was subscribed 7949 times the category reserved for qualified institutional buyers qibs was oversubscribed 5545 times while the noninstitutional investor category saw a huge 33036 times oversubscription now wait for the listing day plunging for the 15th consecutive session shipli cable technologies on friday closed at rs 6745 compared with rs 22570 level the stock had quoted on april 20 there are strong rumours that certain banned stock operators who have been ousted from the market by the securities and exchange board of india have been active on the counter via fronttrading entities the company on april 30 informed stock exchanges that an overseas bank had initiated insolvency and bankruptcy proceedings against it this is strange the stock jumped 588 per cent for the week even the telecom operator reported a net profit of rs 373 crore for the three months ended march its smallest in four years and sharply lower than the average estimate of rs 478 crore that analysts had made in an et poll bharti blamed predatory pricing by new entrant infocomm for the nearly 72 per cent yearonyear slump in fourth quarter net profit the stock managed to post 2 per cent gain for the week during the companys conference call post fourth quarter earnings jhunjhunwala quizzed the companys cfo rohit philip on precisely how the airline plans to address the issue of fluctuating fuel cost the largest domestic airline operator by market share reported a 25 per cent yearonyear slump in march quarter profit at rs 583 crore thanks mainly to a sharp rise in fuel costs stocks such as up 27 per cent 1271 per cent p  g hygiene8 per cent 774 per cent 513 per cent phillips486 per cent 485 per cent and inds 483 per cent for the week the indian meteorological department imd on tuesday said rainfall could be normal and bring 100 per cent rainfall instead of 96 per cent as predicted earlier this year psu banks continued their recent slide shares of 9 of 12 bse psu bank index stocks fell during the week as the recent ordinance enabling rbi to crack down on bad loans was expected to hit banks bottomlines  union bank   iob and plunged up to 7 per cent during the week
title: Buzzing stocks: Glenmark, Yes Bank took a dive; Bharti Airtel surprised

article: the wait is over india has cleared the way for the biggest tax reform since independence in 1947 the main beneficiaries of the new goods and services tax due to be rolled out on july 1 include steelmakers and some consumer goods though personal care items including sanitary ware will be taxed at the top rate along with appliances such as air conditioners heres a look at the winners and losers the sector is a clear winner consumer staples including milk fruits and vegetables grain and cereals have been exempted sugar tea coffee and edible oil will be taxed the lowest rate of 5 percent companies that may gain include  and  personalcare items to be taxed at 28 percent save for hair oil soaps and toothpaste which will attract an 18 percent levy this would impact   marico and  smokers be warned cigarettes will attract a tax of 5 percent on top of the peak rate of 28 percent  godfrey and vst may pass on the higher costs here the impact is likely to be marginal vehicles already attract different levies which add up to 28 percent  the peak gst rate fixed for the sector gains derived from a unified tax system may still be passed on to consumers analysts say  tata motors and could benefit appliances such as airconditioners refrigerators and washing machines will attract the peak rate which is slightly higher than the existing tax slab companies may increase prices to preserve margins nirmal bang said in a note  voltas and could be impacted a reduction in tax on coal and metal ore to 5 percent will cut input costs for steelmakers benefiting companies including  vedanta tata steel and  cement makers including and may increase prices to offset the impact of the peak rate though a lower tax on coal is expected to cushion the blow a 5 percent tax rate on equipment like solar panels and wind turbines may help keep a lid on project costs for developers such as wind and
title: GST deep impact: Here are real winners and losers of tax revamp

article: new delhi just when domestic equity market was showing signs of recovery from the previous weeks carnage the sudden resignation of on friday as md and ceo of it bellwether dampened investor sentiment badly pushing headline indices back into the negative territory on friday the sp bse cracked 271 points to close at 31524 while the broader nifty50 index of the national stock exchange nse lost 67 points to close the session at 9837 with 25 components ending in the green and 26 in the red however on a weekly basis aug 11aug 18 sensex gained 1 per cent while added 13 per cent the coming week is going to be a short one as the market will be closed on friday august 25 2017 on account of ganesh chaturthi lets check out what all might matter to dalal street through the week a hefty share buyback announcement a slew of lawsuits in the us over suspected securities fraud and the ongoing boardroom battle between a founderpromoter and the companys board will continue to swing the infosys stock which has a large weightage in the benchmark indices on saturday the company announced at rs 13000 crore share buyback at a buyback price of rs 1150 which is at a 25 per cent premium to fridays closing of rs 92310 on bse but that may not help much as three us law firms are reported to have mounted suits against the it major and even domestic institutional investor lic has expressed unhappiness over the goingson in the company denting the longterm outlook for the business analysts say the stock will react to all these developments when trading resumes on monday and in all probability the buyback offer at best will help cap the downside on an immediate basis the nifty50 on friday snapped a threeday winning streak and formed a hammer pattern on the daily chart a hammer is formed when the index trades significantly lower than its opening price for most part of the day but manages to recoup losses and close near its opening level analysts say neither is the market going to see any runway rise nor will it witness any major breakdown at best the nifty50 will trade in a broad upward rising channel within a defined range the 9950 and 10150 levels are likely to be immediate resistance for the nifty50 while supports will come in at 9685 and 9580 levels said milan vaishnav a technical analyst bank stocks to be on drivers seat banking stocks will be a major factor deciding the course of the market rbi governor on saturday said staterun banks need more capital to resolve bad loan problems weighing on their balance sheets he said the regulatory challenges of tackling were compounded by weak capital positions of some banks particularly those owned by the government finance minister on saturday said the new insolvency law now sides more with the lenders as the slew of changes in the existing laws are aimed at speeding up resolution this is definitely going to boost banks which are reeling under rs 8 lakh crore of non performing assets npas or bad loans psu banks alone account for about 75 per cent of total bad loans the resignation of a number of top ceos from us president donald trumps manufacturing council following weak initial response to the charlottesville white nationalism march and the sudden ouster of white house chief strategist steve bannon have ignited fresh tensions in the us political  these developments have raised more questions about the trump administrations ability to implement its progrowth agenda markets across the globe including india are likely to see an impact from any significant developments in the us prices jumped three per cent on friday as the dollar fell and us drillers cut rigs feeding a rally that boosted global benchmark brent crude to a weekly gain said a reuters report earlier in the week government data showed crude output was still rising in the us brent and us crude prices both headed for weekly declines of more than 2 per cent but fridays rally left brent with a 15 per cent weekly gain while us crude finished the week virtually flat down just 03 per cent the report added going forward the crude price is likely to sway markets top central bankers including us federal reserves janet yellen and ecbs mario draghi will meet for their annual gettogether at jackson hole wyoming to discuss everything that matters to the global economy several of the developed worlds central banks appear to be on the cusp of beginning a windback of the massive monetary stimulus injected into their economies since the global financial crisis proceedings and outcome of the summit will be watched closely by investors across the globe markit economics will announce nikkei flash japan manufacturing pmi for august the nikkei japan final manufacturing pmi fell to 521 in july 2017 compared to a preliminary reading of 522 and a final print of 524 in junemarkit economics will announce nikkei flash japan manufacturing pmi for august the nikkei japan final manufacturing pmi fell to 521 in july article: new delhi this indian baba is not letting multinational giants sleep peacefully he unleashed a whole range of herbal products to turn the entire fmcg business upside down and then expanded into a whole range of other businesses from ayurvedic media food products textiles  garments and even security solutions last heard the yoga guru is fast expanding production capabilities and taking his battle to the next level by focusing big on branding and marketing to widen reach reports said the company is now seeking to follow a more vertical or deepdive strategy to create more segments within categories this could pose a challenge to most fmcg players which are defending their turf by launching ayurvedic products brokerage nirmal bang institutional equities said in a note patanjali has almost become a fad reaching nearly 53 per cent of indian households in the personal care segment and 26 per cent in food products even in rural households it has built good reach by achieving nearly 24 per cent in personal care and 7 per cent in food and beverages importantly the brand has a very good retention rate and is certainly a challenge for most personal product manufacturers the brokerage said the hurun report india in its latest report on richest indians called patanjali ceo acharya balkrishna the fmcgs maverick yogi balkrishna 45 ranked the eighth richest indian and has seen his surge 173 per cent year on year to rs 70000 crore he is also the most followed entrepreneur on social media with 56 lakh followers on facebook the huran report said the haridwarbased patanjali clocked a turnover of rs 10561 crore in fy17 fmcg accounts for nearly onethird of traditional media ie television print and radio and   remains the highest spender with a 25 per cent share of the overall fmcg ad spend and also spend big on media ads patanjali is catching up fast the company has emerged a large ad spender ranking seventh in the fmcg category and 15th on an overall basis nirmal bang securities said the industry needs to watch the disruptive challenges posed by patanjali closely see table indias consumer spending behaviour is changing fast influenced by product innovation disruptive competition and digital landscape this has kept the industry majors including the mncs on their toes prompting some of them to change business strategies companies that consistently deliver winning consumer offerings through product innovations and distribution are only likely to retain and expand market  said nirmal bang equities the brokerage noted that the share of affluent and elite households in the indian market may double to about 50 per cent from 24 per cent within a decade and that spell big potential for categories like deodorants and skin cream hul and are seen to be outpacing their listed peers with more than 100 basis points improvement in margin expansion supported by strong premiumisation trend and high penetration in modern trade and channels for and colgatepalmolive india we expect margin expansion to be modest as category growth rates are somewhat sluggish and competitive challenges remain higher it said the fmcg index has risen 20 per cent in the last one year itc is up 11 per cent hul 37 per cent 11 per cent and india 12 per cent others such as marico and godrej consumer products have delivered consistently over the past five to six years hul and gillette india have consistently outperformed their parent companies except in 2016 indian consumer and consumer discretionary have consistently traded at significant to their peers and this has been evident not just in bear  but also in a bull markets we are expecting a recovery in home  personal care hpc segment on account of a favourable base and a gradual pickup in growth said nirmal bang institutional equities dabur india emami and cpil are trading at fivetimes peg much higher than pegs of hul and gillette india in the bull phase all stocks are trading at premium but looking at the outlook of these companies we believe the price multiples in case of dabur india cpil and emami are not supported adequately by future earnings growth hul and gillette india have always been trading at substantial premium and we expect them to continue in the same manner the brokerage said
title: Indian baba steals sleep of MNCs! Branding blitz to disrupt market
